about.title: About me
about.description: My academic background has given me critical thinking skills and a great ability to find optimal solutions to complex problems. Added to this is my experience participating in projects and representative bodies, which has allowed me to develop a solid foundation in project management and organizational leadership. I consider myself a proactive person, highly adaptable, and always ready to face new challenges.

timeline.title: Representation Career
timeline.item1Desc: I began my career as a full member of the University Senate, the General Student Delegation (DGE), and consequently, the Student Delegation of the Faculty of Sciences (DEFC). At this time, I also became {bold1} and {bold2}.
timeline.item2Desc: The term for both the DGE and DEFC ended, so I left the positions of Secretary and Treasurer after two years of intense work and dedication. However, I continued as a member in the next term, the current one, since the University Senate term is four years. This allowed me to join the {bold} that same month, where I was a member and participated in its committees until July 2024.
timeline.item3Desc: To improve the management of the DGE's external relations, the position of External Relations Director was created, which I assumed due to my experience in managing trips and contact with other entities. In this role, I have been able to increase the DGE's participation in external events and meetings and strengthen its presence on the national stage. I finished my term in December 2024.
timeline.item4Desc: When a new team had to be presented for the DGE's Permanent Commission, I decided to be part of it as Academic Vice-Coordinator, a position that has allowed me to contribute directly to improving teaching quality and acquiring new guarantees and rights for student assessment. I finished my term in December 2024.
timeline.item5Desc: I am currently part of the Extended Executive Committee of the Coordinator of Student Representatives of Public Universities (CREUP) as Digitalization and Transparency Officer. In this role, I am responsible for maintaining all the association's IT infrastructure, as well as its security, privacy, and data protection policies.

events.title: Organized Events
events.event1Desc: Together with three other people, I organized an ordinary general assembly of the National Association of Mathematics Students (ANEM), an event attended by around 60 people. My tasks mainly consisted of managing payments from different organizers, organizing coffee breaks, and requesting space reservations.
events.event2Desc: Although this is an event I have been participating in since 2019, in this edition of my Faculty's patron saint I was more involved than ever in its organization. Together with another person, I was in charge of organizing the star activity, bingo with Andrés Quintana Martín, which was attended by around 300 people. The organization of the activity consisted of creating bingo cards using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript {link1} and creating a web platform to display the results {link2}.
events.event3Desc: As External Relations Director, I helped organize the XIII ordinary general assembly of the Andalusian University Councils Assembly, attended by around 20 people. I was mainly in charge of organizing coffee breaks, managing meals, and subsequently processing invoices.
events.event4Desc: I was the main organizer of the 77th CREUP Ordinary General Assembly, coordinating space reservations and contacts with the different bodies involved. Additionally, I was in charge of the event's financial management and fundraising.
events.event5Desc: I am Treasurer and Secretary of the Organizing Committee for the XXVI National Meeting of Mathematics Students (ENEM), which brings together hundreds of students of Mathematics, Statistics, and Data Science from all over Spain every year. These meetings have both an academic and professional focus, allowing direct contact with companies in the sector.
